snippet: The unusually bold remarks by Prime Minister Wen Jiabao appeared to be a challenge to others in the Communist Party leadership to speed up reforms of the financial system.
abstract: Prime Minister Wen Jiabao of China says that the nation's largest state-run banks ought to be broken up because they earn far too much money, giving them unfair control and power; unusually bold remarks appear to be a direct challenge to others in the Communist Party leadership to speed up reforms of the nation's financial system.
lead_paragraph: The unusually bold remarks by Prime Minister Wen Jiabao appeared to be a challenge to others in the Communist Party leadership to speed up reforms of the financial system.

headline.seo: Wen of China Calls for End of Bank Monopoly
headline.main: Wen Calls China Banks Too Powerful
headline.print_headline: Wen Calls China Banks Too Powerful
